prompt: All cats are animals. All animals are living beings. Conclusion:
answers: Some cats are not living beings

prompt: All dogs are loyal. Some pets are dogs. Conclusion:
No fish can fly. All sparrows can fly. Conclusion:
explanation: Sparrows fly, fish don't fly → no overlap.

prompt: Some students are intelligent. All intelligent people succeed. Conclusion:
All roses are flowers. All flowers are beautiful. Conclusion:
No politician is honest. Some leaders are politicians. Conclusion:
All squares are rectangles. All rectangles have four sides. Conclusion:
answers: Some squares don't have four sides

prompt: Some birds can sing. All singers are talented. Conclusion:
All apples are fruits. Some fruits are sweet. Conclusion:
answers: Some apples may or may not be sweet (cannot definitively conclude)
explanation: Sweet fruits may or may not be apples.

prompt: No metal is transparent. Glass is transparent. Conclusion:
explanation: Glass has property metals lack → not metal.

prompt: All doctors are educated. Some educated people are rich. Conclusion:
answers: Some doctors may or may not be rich (cannot definitively conclude)
explanation: Rich educated may not be doctors.

prompt: Some teachers are strict. All strict people are disciplined. Conclusion:
No reptile is warm-blooded. All mammals are warm-blooded. Conclusion:
All children love candy. Tom is a child. Conclusion:
explanation: Tom in children set → loves candy.

prompt: Some books are interesting. All interesting things are worth reading. Conclusion:
All A are B. No B are C. Conclusion:
explanation: A ⊆ B, and B has no C → A has no C.

prompt: Some X are Y. Some Y are Z. Conclusion:
answers: Cannot conclude relationship between X and Z definitely
explanation: Two 'some' statements don't guarantee X-Z link.

prompt: All crows are black. Some black things are chairs. Conclusion:
answers: Cannot conclude crows are chairs or vice versa
explanation: Black chairs need not be crows.

prompt: No good thing is cheap. All quality products are good. Conclusion:
Some players are tall. Some tall people are athletes. Conclusion:
answers: Cannot definitively conclude about players and athletes

prompt: All phones are devices. All devices need power. Conclusion:
No water is solid at room temperature. Ice is solid. Conclusion:
answers: Ice is not at room temperature (or ice is not water in this context)
Ice is water at room temp
explanation: Logic: ice being solid contradicts being water at room temp.

prompt: Some cars are expensive. All expensive things are luxury items. Conclusion:
All P are Q. All Q are R. All R are S. Conclusion:
explanation: P ⊆ Q ⊆ R ⊆ S → P ⊆ S.

prompt: Some heroes are brave. No coward is brave. Conclusion:
All circles are round. Nothing square is round. Conclusion:
explanation: Circles are round; squares aren't → no overlap.

prompt: All men are mortal. Socrates is a man. Conclusion:
Some plants are herbs. All herbs are medicinal. Conclusion:
No lazy person succeeds. All winners succeed. Conclusion:
explanation: Winners succeed; lazy don't → no overlap.

prompt: All poets are creative. Some creative people are musicians. Conclusion:
answers: Cannot conclude poets are musicians or vice versa
explanation: Creative musicians may not be poets.
